item.description:
Participatory Chinatown Community Meeting
Monday, May 03, 2010 from 6:00 PM - 8:30 PM (ET)
Boston, MA

Questions?
Contact Janelle Chan via email at janelle.chan@asiancdc.org - or phone her at 617-482-2380 x 209.

Come and experience enhanced 3-D visualizations of Chinatown today and scenarios for Chinatown of the future!

ACDC and our partners are hosting a community meeting on Monday, May 3 to discuss the development for the area south of the Turnpike in Boston's Chinatown. While interacting with enhanced virtual environments, attendees of this meeting will learn about issues that affect land-use planning in Chinatown and be asked to give feedback about potential development scenarios for the neighborhood.

Food will be provided to participants beginning at 6:00pm. The meeting itself will start promptly at 6:30pm, so please don't be late!

ACDC welcomes Chinatown residents and community members to be participants.
All ages welcome! The meeting will be translated into Cantonese, also, and bilingual youth will be present to assist attendees in need of language or technical support.

Participatory Chinatown is a collaborative project of Asian Community Development Corporation, Emerson College, and Metropolitan Area Planning Council, funded by The John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation.

Read the ACDC blog at http://blog.participa... for more information about the project and our process.

Follow ACDC on Twitter: @ChinatownDML

Event hosts from THIS meetup are sought.

Visit http://www.eventbrite... where you can get your free ticket to the event.

group.name: The Boston Mandarin Chinese Language Meetup Group

item.name: Participatory Chinatown Community Meeting: 3-D visualizations of Chinatown
